result.execSummary:
The defendant William C Hoover was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Escape-Criminal Arrest [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(3)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Extended supervision ordered on the sentence he is now serving.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Must seek and maintain employment satisfactory to your probation agent.  Defendant  must not leave or change employment without prior approval of his probation agent.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Attend CGIP, if not already satisfied.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
JOC returned undelivered "Return to Sender Not Deliverable as Addressed Unable to Forward"  
Returned from New Lisbon Correctional - "Inmate Not at Institution Forward Has Expired"
Sentencing after revocation hearing 7-12-2018

Assistant District Attorney, Emily Hynek appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Geraldson.  Parties have the revocation packet.  No changes or corrections.  No victim.  State recommended:  220 days credit.  18 months jail.  Concurrent with sentence now serving. Defense agrees with the jail sentence recommendation.   Defense says defendant has 433 days of credit.  Defendant exercised his right to allocution.  

Court ordered: 18 months initial confinement, and 18 months extended supervision.  Concurrent with the prison sentence he is now serving. La Crosse County Case No.  17CF1119.  Credit for 433 days.  Forgive remaining costs. due.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on July 12, 2018 at 11:30 am.
From Probation Agent Helm
Routed to Judge
Atty Joseph Geraldson advised that he will be representing Mr. Hoover on his upcoming SEHR.
from La Crosse Cty DA for cc:JOC (sent out today)

form filed.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Poss.  No victim notification needed.  15CM188 DRI.  Plead to count 1 as charged.  Count 2 to be dismissed.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties on the count he is pleading to.  Defendant understood.  Defendant plead no contest.  Repeater allegation confirmed.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant. Felony warnings given.   Defendant understood.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of Count 1 as charged. 15CM188 and Count 2 in 15CF145 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes..  Joint recommendation for  probation, 3 years.  AODA.  o/m employment when agent deems it appropriate.  Not to terminate without agent's approval.  CGIP.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.   Court ordered:  sentence withheld, 3 years probation. Concurrent to ES ordered on sentence now serving.   AODA, and recommended treatment.     Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion. Subject to random drug testing.  Obtain and maintain employment.  Not to terminate without agent's approval.  Attend CGIP, or other criminal thinking programming. The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  CC, DNA surcharge.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 31, 2016 at 11:30 am.
ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant was not transported for plea/sentencing today.  Reschedule with Judge's office.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 03-14-2016 01:30 pm
Recorded.  DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared through Attorney Poss.  Defendant in New Lisbon Correctional.  Have an agreement in principle.  Set for plea/sentencing.

Pre-trial conference at 01-27-2016 10:00 am.
Status conference at 02-15-2016 03:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for William C Hoover
Current: PO Box 661, C/O Dodge Correctiona Institution, Waupun, WI 53963-0661 United States  (Effective: 01-07-2016)
Prior: Justice Center, 320 S. Walnut St., c/o Outagamie County Jail, Appleton, WI 54911-5918 United States

Defendant appeared by video from Dodge Correctional Institution with counsel SPD William Poss present in the courtroom.  ADA Inlow is present for the State.  Attorney Poss states he sent all the wavier of prelim paperwork on 15CF145 to defendant but hasn't received anything back.  Defendant states he received it but he doesn't have any way to mail it back.  He did look the paperwork over.  Attorney Poss wishes to proceed and will put the waiver of preliminary hearing colloquy on the record.  He states he reviewed everything with his client prior to today's hearing.  Attorney Poss will send a SASE to his client to return the signed documents so they can be filed.  Defendant has no objection to appearing by video for today's hearing.  Attorney Poss states he advised his client of his right to a preliminary hearing within the time limits and he wishes to waive his right to the preliminary hearing and have his arraignment today.  He believes he understands and is knowingly and voluntarily waiving that right.  Court reviews right to preliminary hearing with defendant and explains what a preliminary hearing entails.  Defendant has no questions.  Court performs colloquy and finds he knowingly, and intelligently waives his right to the preliminary hearing and is bound over for trial.  State files Information which attorney Poss will mail a copy to his client.  Defense waives the reading of the Information, stands mute.  Court sets pretrial date for 1-27 at 10:00 and status for 2-15 at 3:00 on both 15CF145 & 15CM188.  Defendant does not need to appear at STC.  Defendant may move to another facility soon so Court instructed him to make contact with his social worker at the new facility right away so he can let his attorney/Court know where he is located.
of 1/7 Arraignment notice
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment at 01-07-2016 10:45 am
Per SPD Bill Poss - defendant was transferred from Outagamie County jail to prison so he is trying to locate him and will schedule on VTC date in January.

No appearance by defendant.  SPD Poss states that the defendant is still in Outagmie County Jail and will be going to prison for 15 months likely.  They do not have an agreement at this point.  ADA Inlow states 15CF145 needs to be scheduled for preliminary hearing.  Attorney Poss asks if a waiver can be done by VTC.  Court states only if the defendant doesn't object.  SPD Poss is to schedule next hearing on a VTC date if that's what is needed.  I sent a copy of minutes to H.Z.
